text: This place is absolutely amazing! I loved the strawberry melonade and the "all about me" sandwich was DELICIOUS!! Nothing tastes as good as fresh basil on a sandwich!! I love love love this place and you should definitely eat here too!
The cutest little shop with the friendliest baristas and the bombest food and drinks. My go-to coffee shop when I come to Vegas now.
Amazing place! Staff is so kind, and the atmosphere is fresh and relaxing. Best latte I have had in the valley and the food is amazing!
This little coffee shop had the best chai tea ever!  Reminds me a little of illy.. Clean place!  The waffles were delicious.    Latte was good, but nothing special.
What an amazing coffee shop! Such wonderful service and the coffee was delicious! I would highly recommend this place. Try their blended white  chocolate macadamia nut coffee, it's to die for!
Met a friend for a business meeting. The space was clean and inviting. I enjoyed the coffee and atmosphere. Everyone inside was friendly.  I will definitely return.

Greeted by a lovely lady at the counter that seemed to maybe own the coffeehouse. She was knowledgeable of the whole menu and was just a pleasure to interact with. My caramel latte and "All About Me" sandwich lived up to the expectations and was quite satisfying. My SO ordered the dragonfruit smoothie which was equally amazing. Not too sweet and not too sour. Definitely will be back for the service and good eats/drinks.
Awesome espresso and even better when paired with their delicious brownies. The staff is also great.
This place has unique and delicious drinks. When you walk in it looks cozy and modern at the same time.
I've been a usual here for quite a while. Awesome coffee/ brunch menu, bright clean setting, vinyl records playing, local art, great staff.

Wonderful service! It wasn't super crowded which I appreciated. My friend and I both had coffee (they have cold brew!!!) and the barista was nice. The owner was actually there too and helped make our coffee and sandwiches. After we paid they said we could take a seat and they would bring us our order. The food/coffee was an 11/10 and now I recommend this place to everyone I know! 

This will probably become my primary place to study in the fall. I think what I loved most was that they had a full menu of food available. Often times I can't find a place that has a full menu and when I do it's outrageously expensive. The coffee prices were nice too. Overall this was a wonderful experience for me. I plan to go back.

This place is amazing! One of the best places I've been in Vegas! Although it's a coffeehouse, it has the best sandwiches!!! I have tried many of their drinks and snacks and have not been disappointed! The service is great, and the team of employees here are very polite and take care of whatever you need! I highly recommend this place! The atmosphere is very relaxing!

Love this place! The staff is always friendly, coffee and food are great. My go to drinks are the pistacio delight, green me up, and cookies and cream. My favorite sandwich is the all about me. I would definitely recommend stopping by if you are on this side of town.

I certainly suggest their MACADAMIA NUT LATTE! It is absolutely delicious. The employees are outgoing which is makes every visit a good one. The overall appearance of the shop is small, simple, and minimal. It's a very calming place to be in!

I love this place! Had the best little individual apple pie and a great skim latte. My friends had sandwiches and loved them. Really friendly owners and a lovely mid century inspired vibe inside. I'll definitely be back.

This is my new favorite coffee shop in Vegas. The food and coffee is delicious. On top of that, it is adorable inside. Really cute decor and nice vibe. Deborah, the owner, always makes a point to welcome you and make you feel at home. The staff is just wonderful. You need to go here immediately!  Trust me.
Honestly just a quality place. Very nicely decorated, helpful service, and tasteful food and drink will definitely be bringing me back to Pour!

Soooo excited about my new foodie find! Close to work, across from Sunset Park. Pistachio blended latte, snagged a few fresh pastries, and munching on the Breakfast bombness sandwich. Chill music, clean place, and friendly service..a recipe for #repeatbusiness.

Pour coffeehouse is a blessing!! The staff is great, the owner is amazing. The food yummy my daughter and I had the Caribbean sandwich and Raspberry white chocolate milk,also oreo milk shake so good! And Saturdays they allow kids to read their stories they have written. I give POUR coffeehouse 5 stars. Will be going back again!
Extremely nice and comfortable environment. Breakfast items are unique and delicious. Highly recommend their "Breakfast Bombness"

Picked up a pretty good iced latte this morning. Tried a muffin too. It seemed fresh. Not too shabby. Really liked the vibe and decor inside. I'd like to try something else off the menu next time. The location is pretty great since it's across Sunset Park. Could make for a nice morning. Staff was very friendly as well.

Went to Pour for the first time this week for cappuccino. The cappuccino was great and the ambiance was very nice. A very relaxing place and they play vinyl records for background music. They have a selection of vinyl's that you can look through and pick one for them to play. The personnel here are friendly and professional. Recommend!
Love this place.  Never had a dirty chai or coffee I didn't like.  The Owner is willing to make anything to your liking, she puts her heart in every cup!!

The menu on the wall was too small for me to read (and I don't require glasses). I had to squint, and since there were people sitting right beneath it (pretty much in front of it) I clearly made them uncomfortable looking so sternly in their direction.

I just paid $5 for a "strawberry melonade", and then watched this girl pour me a boring lemonade fountain drink and drip in some Torani strawberry flavoring and top it off with bottled water from a mini fridge.

I would've laughed and walked out if I hadn't already paid, but I was already the butt of this joke. I took my drink and expressed my displeasure with the lack of any fresh ingredients, and sat down to relax out of the 113 degree heat. 

Unfortunately I don't think this place has adequate AC, it felt like a balmy 85 degrees in this place. Perhaps building an entire wall of windows in a coffee shop in the desert wasn't prudent planning. Perhaps them filling my lemonade to the brim with ice was supposed to cool me down. My only reprieve was that there was so little lemonade in my cup that my lemonade was gone within 3 sips and I didn't have any further excuse to sit in this overrated, overpriced, overheated hipster haven, complete with a record player on the counter playing Bob Dylan and the 20-something year old boys in the corner calling each other bro.

My lemonade was drinkable and cold. That's the only reason Pour got 2 stars from me. You can get a better tasting cold drink for less money pretty much anywhere in this city. I'll probably try Heidi's deli in the same plaza next time. Their menu shows they have fresh juices and smoothies.

I have become pretty regular at Pour. Why? The bright, cheery atmosphere; the beautiful view of Sunset Park across the street; the fact that this is the most clean coffee house ever; the aromas; the vanilla latte; the staff; the fact Deborah knows me by name; the fact they are trying to be more than a coffee house but a part of the community and look to try new things to enhance your experience....I could go on but....when my doctor told me to get off coffee, I switched to LondonFog. Black tea with shot of vanilla and steamed milk. (Although my friends suggested I find another doctor!) So I can still go here! Check out the 3rd Saturday Rhythm and Rhyme brunch. You won't be disappointed.

I've been wanting to come here for a while. This little coffee house is cute, clean, and quiet. Loved the natural light. Free WiFi! I enjoyed the Breakfast Bombness with a Vanilla Latte while watching people play frisbee golf at Sunset Park across the street. The sandwich was a good size and tasty. Just needed a dash of salt. The Vanilla Latte was a little sweeter than I'm used to, but it was a good balance for the sandwich. I didn't see that there were many breakfast options, but I'd like to come back for lunch sometime soon. Friendly staff and there was even holiday music playing :) Good spot for friends to sit and chat.
This place is worth a stop. Met the owner and chatted for a bit. Sat in house with our coffee and juice. Great latte with full bodied flavor! Definitely recommend it.

Pour Coffeehouse is the best coffee house hands down in Las Vegas. The coffee, pastries, and vibe is amazing! The owner makes sure you are taken care of. I highly recommended you check out the events on www.pourlv.com If you need to explore better places I highly recommended Pour

Love to come here! Friendly staff, variety of menu selections, lots of natural light, well-kept. We've been there for lunch a few times and always very satisfied. I like the healthy options. . Lots  of parking and easy access makes the whole experience wonderful.
My soy latte was so hot a perfect! The food was simple and tasty. Pleasant staff who were friendly ..

I got to go here in the afternoon for a little pick-me-up. As soon as we walked in, I noticed the cute and clean setting, and the staff was also very welcoming.
Gentleman with the "Rogue" (X-Men) streaks was nice to give me a drink recommendation called Pistachio Delight. LOL. Asked him if they could add a shot of espresso too, and he was like "Yeah, we'd just make it a Dirty Pistachio Delight." 
Did it taste as good as it sounded? Heck yes. Did it also give me a good afternoon wake-up? Sure did. LOL. I'm betting the boyfriend wishes I was less hyper before and during shopping.
The owner herself prepared and served us our order.  She is very knowledgeable and nice.  The place is artistic and cool!  A very nice place to hang out and just relax.

I started coming here when I began working in the same office park. My friend and I go almost every weekday for a midday pick me up. They have a lot of unique drinks and yummy treats to go along with them! I love how the staff remembers my favorites and even makes suggestions on new things to try based on my preferences. Also, just had the most amazing BLT sandwich I've had in a while.  :-)
Excellent vanilla latte.  I travel all over and the coffee was noteworthy.  Will go back when I'm near Sunset Park.
Great coffee (super strong, I was buzzing all night!) and lemon pound cake! Sad that sandwiches are only served before 2pm. Other than that my visit was great.

First time here.

Ex boyfriend and I came in and I insisted he try the pistacio drink because I know how much he loves Pistaccios (sp) and he loved it, I ordered the sin city which was equally delish but what really impressed me was the 3 bean bowl I ordered, it comes with red onions and I asked for those to be removed, the girl said thats how it comes, pre-made, I said no worries I can pick around them...

When I got home to eat it, I discovered it had NO red onions, the woman who made it had custom made it for me, wow, I am so happy and its delicious by the way!

It had tomatoes which may have already been in there or switched for the onions, not sure, I dont know, I just will be returning there ASAP to have another bowl and more drinks!

Thank you so much!!

Delicious coffee and breakfast sandwich.  I come to Vegas for work every other week and Pour is right by one of my work sites.  This is my second time here.  This time I came for breakfast.  This coffee shop has great sandwich selections both for lunch and breakfast.  The owner makes them personally.  The snowball flavored latte is to die for.  Will definitely keep coming back
Love their bohemian relax atmosphere!!! Got great coffee asked for an Americano black....how relax 100%

New local coffee shop option across from Sunset Park, in the same business park as Heidi's Brooklyn Deli. Menu offers hot, iced, and blended beverages, along with light breakfast and lunch food options. A few cookies, macarons, and brownies are on display at the counter. Service is friendly, soy milk is available.

The iced café mocha with dark chocolate and soy milk was a tastier option than the cold brew with added vanilla sweetener (which somehow ended up more like a latte). Coffee itself was robust, a large is around $5.

This is a great place to hangout.  The ambiance is great.  The staff are really nice and helpful and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your time here.  The prices are reasonable for the quality of food and beverages available.  

If you are meeting up with friends or colleagues stop by here.  You won't regret it.
This is my go to spot when I want a good latte, quiet place, and a relaxed environment. They also have good sandwiches, tea, and a chess board! I don't play but I try. Support this local business!!
Come get inspired in this beautiful coffee shop. The owner Deborah is such a great person. Come support me

I've been meaning to try out Pour for awhile and, luckily, I was in the area after getting some breakfast.

First impressions of the place is how beautifully light and airy it is on the inside. Don't, get me wrong, I love the cliche earthy cafe vibes that every coffee shop has, but this was a nice change. It gave me this feeling of being healthy, as if my iced caramel latte was a nice green smoothie instead (which they do have there). I absolutely love that they have a record player available for customers to use and a great selection of vinyls available (3 Tame Impala vinyls - yes!).

Debra and Tia prepared me an iced caramel latte & an iced hazelnut latte. I immediately fell in love with the hazelnut latte; its wonderfully sweet and nutty. I'll definitely will be coming back to reorder it!
Tried an iced coffee with vanilla and lavender syrup, it was so refreshing for summer. The avocado toast was also amazing
Love this place! Best service and I love the vibes ! If you go in there enough the staff will become apart of your family! Everyone is so caring and compassionate. I love the art they have :)

wow, this place is amazing!!
I have to say this place is better than Starbucks.
The food. drinks, and staff are amazing.
it is also a great spot to come study, unwind, or to grab a bite.

Visiting for Vegas and wanted a quick coffee and bite.

Staff was great, place is clean.
Surprise the place wasn't more packed but it must be a new place.

Get the iced latte with coconut! Breakfast sandwich was delicious.

Visiting back in June and definitely coming back to this place!

Pour is my go to study spot! I have visited many times in the past year, all during different times of the day.  There are many things that keep me coming back.  The atmosphere is light, open, and inviting sitting in a bright location across from Sunset park.  The lavender latte is by far the best I have encountered, especially in Las Vegas. Their lavender infused syrup is crafted in house giving it a natural and fresh flavor found in every cup.  Additionally, Pour is vegan/vegetarian friendly with an assortment of house made, specialty foods and a variety of drinks beyond their beautifully crafted espresso and coffee selections.  If you sit around long enough you're likely to find some genuine conversation.
AWESOME!!! I go there whenever I can to get coffee/tea and pastries! The service is grand and the employees are friendly. The coffee is on point as well! :p

I am in Las Vegas for work about 6X/year and yesterday I wanted a good cup of coffee and a breakfast snack.  Boy, did I land at the right place!  Great, friendly service; excellent coffee and the Breakfast Bombness is just that.  The Americano was great with a nice caramel colored foam on the top.  Hope I will be in the neighborhood again on future trips.  Nice work from this cohesive team.

Never noticed this coffee shop right in front of sunset park. It's a cool hangout spot with a nice environment. The two ladies working there were nice and friendly. The coffee and food were amazing. Differently will be going there more often.

Great place to study, especially if you love big open windows with natural light and decent sized tables (important if you're a table hog like me).  Not too loud or too busy either. There are also comfortable cushy chairs to chill in when you want to take a break (and a park across the street to walk in for that matter too). Good variety of tasty sandwiches and pastries too; definitely try the 'Its All About Me' sandwich and the London Fog Lavender Latte.  Best part are the super sweet and accommodating baristas that are more than willing to let you try different flavors in your cold brew or check up on your drinks when you've been sitting there a long time. Thanks!
Best coffee shop in town to get some writing done and enjoy a tasty beverage. Music is not too loud and atmosphere relaxing. Friendly attentive employees and owner.

Very clean! Great coffee! Friendly staff and the owner is as well. I've been to this shop a couple times and with excellent outcomes each time. This last time I went I got a scoop of ice cream with two shots of espresso (I can't remember the exact name)...amazing! 

With lots of coffee shops to choose from this is a place at the top of my list above the others. The food options are great tasting as well:)

The menu is simple but hanged occasionally which I really like. Other shops have confusing menus and when asking staff they don't know the answers. Pour's staff is knowledgeable of everything.

I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my visit to pour. I ordered a BLT which was flavorful and not overly greasy as the bacon can sometimes get that way. This store has a great ambiance and it's easy to get lost in conversation (indication of a great coffeehouse)

I did order the melonade which I thought was entirely too sweet... felt as if i was drinking a watermelon jolly rancher. I'll be back to try a different drink though!

My parents moved to the Vegas area from Southern California and each time I come out here this is my favorite place to stop! The coffee is fantastic and I can eat here without feeling any guilt. Deborah (the owner) is so welcoming and kind, too. Happy to support a small business and feel good about my purchase!

Oh I love this place! Surprised it took me so long to try it since I live pretty close by. Perfect for a low-key, casual brunch. They got your breakfast sandwiches as well as "lunch" sandwiches. Their drink menu is pretty big and they got some caffeine-free drinks available as well.

Boyfriend ordered the Breakfast Bombness sandwich and I ordered the Turkey and What Else sandwich which came with Lay's potato chips. I've got to admit, the sandwiches were on the smaller side. Even though I'm a small eater, my boyfriend and I could have easily split a second sandwich. I  guess it's a good thing the sandwiches are small...you can watch your calories. 

We were here on a Saturday afternoon and the one and only drink my boyfriend wanted to try was the Pistachio Delight and they were out of ingredients on the day we went!!!!!!!!!! What the..... how in the world..... why!? =( boo. If they had that item available, this review might been pushed up to 5 stars. So he ended up getting a cold brew iced coffee. He enjoyed it. You need a strong caffinee boost? Screw the big corporate places....come here and get yourself one of these! It'll definitely give you a huge pep in your step. Great tasting coffee. I got an iced coconut latte and it was delish!! 

We will definitely be back....there's other sandwiches I wanna try!

I wish there was a location closer to me. Definitely worth the drive. The staff is always exceptional and the drinks are delicious! 
I love how Pour embraces the community by displaying and selling local artist's work. It keeps the decor fun in an already immaculate setting.

OMG!!!  I am so happy that this place exists!  My friend and I decided to check it out recently.  We had no idea what to order, so we both just went with small blended, flavored lattes. So good!  They had such a great selection of flavors.  My drink was the perfect amount of strong and not too sweet.  

The coffee shop was so nice inside.  Good amount of seating and fresh flowers on the tables.  Employees were friendly.  After looking at their menu, I can't wait to try all of the other drinks and taste the food too!
Turkey special wrap was delicious. Nice friendly environment. And flavorful iced coffee. Will definitely return.
Affogato (expresso over ice cream) is my favourite! The staff is always nice. Right next to Sunset Park, this place is a gem. One of my favorite coffee spots in Vegas.

Amazing!! We got the waffles and the Breakfast Bombness and it was delicious! Everyone was so nice and the owner came and introduced herself and made sure we were happy with our food and drinks. Would recommend to anyone.

Deborah and her team are amazing in this nicely decorated coffee shop. I love the atmosphere, the bites and the COFFEE IS AMAZING!!! I would give this place 10 stars if I could. LGBT friendly and we love them even more for that. 

If you have not stopped by to see this gem of a coffee house.. do yourself a favor and stop by and see them You will find yourself in love with their wonderfully large options of coffee!!!

Love you guys!

My name is Nathen, and I'm an addict. 

Yeah, buddy. Coffee is my drug of choice (before 9 am) and Pour gave me a sweet fix. This small coffee house is right across the street from Sunset Park and is a great place to fill up or wind down after a rousing game of Disc Golf. As far as the food goes, I've only tried the English Muffin breakfast sandwich; it was tasty but overpriced. I would stick with the coffee options and a full sized sandwich to get a better bang for your buck. 

The coffee here is great, fresh espresso and simple, but perfect coffee drinks. Their cold brew is the way to go if you're into cold coffee drinks and the espresso pulls are smooth and rich. Heads up, when you check-in on Yelp you get 15% off your coffee order, kaboom!

By the way, my drug of choice after 9 am is burritos.

Finally took the time to visit this spot since every time I'd think about going, I'd remember the construction on Eastern and just to go Sunrise Coffee instead lol. Pour is located across Sunset Park in a shopping center with Roberto's and Heidi's Brooklyn Deli with a small parking lot but a lot of empty spaces. Walking inside I was really surprised at how bright and clean it was. Large windows and lots of seating. Seems like a great spot for people bust out their laptops and chill.  However, I feel like their hours will really limit that being 7am-5pm Monday through Friday and 8am-2pm on Saturday and Sunday. Who knows, maybe they'll extend their hours if they get more popular especially since they're only about 10-15 minutes away from UNLV.

So as for the most important stuff, we tried their Iced Raspberry Chocolate at only $4.80 and oh man, this drink was incredibly smooth! Had almost like a velvet texture! Not as much strong coffee flavor that I get from Sunrise Coffee but I'd definitely compare this place to Grouchy John's. Bomb.com Definitely recommend getting this one. They also offer a lot of cool options on their menu including non-espresso items like their Pistachio Delight (which I'll probably try next time) and Paninis served from 8am-2pm. Paninis=awesome. Time limit on Paninis=not so awesome. But I'm definitely eyeing their Caribbean Special which includes fried plantains, mustard, hot sauce, avocado, tomatoes and turkey! Also their Apple Cheddar sounds pretty cool including fig jam, apples, olive oil and cheddar. As for other food options, they have waffles (served only Saturday and Sunday) and bakery items like mini salted caramel apple pies, chocolate brownies, and vegan chocolate chip cookies! Basically I feel like this place is a mix between Grouchy John's and Tiabi Coffee & Waffles, which in my opinion is pretty amazing.

As for service, everyone was really friendly. I'd only recommend they turn the music a little bit up, since it was a little awkward with it being so quiet. But overall, I'll definitely be back to try more drinks and some of their tasty sounding waffles and paninis :)

Love how close this is to Sunset Park. I can grab my usual cold brew or pistachio milk drink (to effing die for!) and go my way to the park and walk my pup. I also love their staff! They're super friendly and welcoming. Will definitely keep coming here.

Tried the Dragonfruit smoothie and it was so good with just the right amount of sweetness. The place is cute and has an a gender neutral restroom. The barista is very sweet, she was pretty busy though! Workin hard! Thank you it was great!

My wife and I visited this coffee house and I love it. There are only a few chic coffeehouses like this in Las Vegas/Henderson. They do have a variety of good coffee selections and brewing technique to choose from, quiet atmosphere to work/study and open space concept. 

Other nice touches: 
- They have a record player with a small selection of records. 
- They also have artworks on the walls. 
- I also like their logo
Best coffee in town !!! i try every place in las vegas but this one is my favorite place !!! the staff are super cool Great job !!! Coffee have flavor and sandwich tasty yummy !!

Pour is now at the top of my favorite coffee shops in town. Their coffee is out of this world, and their guest service is beyond. Every time I stop by I feel very welcomed. If you have haven't visited this place You are really missing. Truss me you won't regret it.
This is pretty CL place! The avocado toast was awesome, so was the chai tea latte! The ambiance was great. Only thing could have been better was a much hotter chai

Had another great gustatory experience at POUR today. Owner and very hip chick Deborah made a rocking turkey and avocado sandwich on a fresh baked croissant. Best part was how they toast the bottom to keep the sandwich together structurally. Always great breakfast and lunch chow but the free trade from woman-owned farms is ultra smooth and dee-lish!  Their modern aesthetic along with the rotating display of local artists always feels like I'm chilling in a cozy modern art gallery, but with (good/non-starbucks) music.

This is probably my favorite place for a good old sandwich. Who know how tasty it would be to have plantain in your sandwiches? The sandwich was full of flavor. Sweet, sour and tangy after just one first bite. It's so much more enjoyable with potato chips and their Matcha Green Tea drink! My boyfriend and I had to come here twice before he left. We thought the price was reasonable and their drink tasted pretty great. The place was so hip too. Art wall, plants on the table, and lights. Those tend to be the best cafes to sit, eat and drink with family and friends or maybe even alone! It wasn't busy during the times we went which was about lunch time. And if you also check in, you can enjoy 10-15% off I believe?

I came here because I was in the area and wanted to try a new coffeeshop. My boyfriend had friends who had performed at this coffeeshop before and he also wanted to consult with the owner about potentially performing there himself. 

I love love LOVE all the succulents around the windowd, on the counter, and on the tables. Many of them have little price stickers on them if you feel compelled to purchase one, along with the business owner's cards so that you can check them out yourself. Just the fact that those cards were around the place, and that they allow Vegas musicians to perform here, tells me they hugely support local work, which I appreciate! It's well lit inside and spacious, and it seems like a great spot to work on your laptop.

Typically I like my drinks chocolatey, but not too chocolatey. I'm kind of picky with what I like to drink and was worried that the Chocolate Iced Latte sub soy milk would be too sweet or too "coffee" tasting, but this wasn't the case. My drink tasted so good! 

As for the food, I ordered the Breakfast Bombness. Tasty, but small. I do wish it was a little bigger, since I think it was a little over $5 and the size of a egg mcmuffin, if not a bit smaller. However, it did taste very good! 

If I'm ever in the area again, I guarantee I'll come back. Sunset Park is close by and an area I sometimes go to so it's convenient that it's so close.

Came here last night for their Christmas Karaoke night and I have to admit, I enjoyed it.  I've never experienced karaoke at a coffee shop before. I'm used to bars where there's alcohol to tame the fear of stage fright.  

The staff at this location were super awesome and nice.  Their drinks and food are tasty.  Definitely a cozy joint and I can't wait to come back again for karaoke night.  

They also have cute potted succulent plants for sale there. I can't wait to go back to pick one out and take home.

Stopped by today, excellent cappuccino (made by Tia), and the Iced Vanilla Latte my wife had was also good not overly sweet, my sons Mocha was also solid and not overly sweet. The manager that took our order was very welcoming and pleasant. Great Coffee, Great service, Cool art on the walls, be sure to support this local Gem.

I was on my way to Starbucks, but saw a huge "Now Open" sign in front of this shop, so I decided to stop in. They just opened this past Monday 10/19, but with all the construction that our city has been experiencing lately, the plaza is slightly hidden and hard to turn into. I ended up trying a 12oz cold brew with vanilla sweetener. Pretty good! I'll update my review with forthcoming visits.

**Update: Stopped by for a couple more visits. Construction still ongoing. Their cold brew and iced coffee have been consistently smooth and pretty potent if you're going for the wakefulness factor. (I'm pretty basic and haven't had the chance to try any of their flavored lattes or blended drinks.) Service so far has been pleasant, but the decor is still quite sterile and walls seemingly naked. They did get a menu board, so that's progress. If they develop a little more on creating an inviting and cozy atmosphere, I think this would be a great alternative spot to the handful of coffee shops in the area.

The breakfast sandwich I had tasted good along with the blueberry muffin. I had the French press and my wife had a pour over, both drinks came out great. It looks like they are sourcing the beans from Mothership. Convenient location across from the park.
The service was amazing! The iced americano was perfect! Great roast used! The vegan black bean and avocado will be in my dreams! It was fresh, flavorful and had the perfect amount of spice!
Love love this place. They have excellent coffee and they blow you know who out of the water. I get excellent service here every time.

I heard about this shop on the radio as a "new coffee shop" and thought I would give it a try .. Upon entering I was not greeted , asked if it was my first time there or helped with the menu. I ordered a caramel macchiato which ended up having chocolate in it that I wasn't informed of and could have been avoided if someone spoke to me when I entered . The man working there kindly remade it which I appreciated .. While I was waiting I asked if I could give away the incorrect coffee (which they do at sunrise and Starbucks) possibly with a business card (since they are new) instead of it being wasted .. There were three people there and I got three different answers and ultimately a woman walked up and did not introduce herself and asked me what I wanted to do and I explained and she said no .. I am assuming that she was the owner. Certainly wasn't a very great or friendly first impression at Pour.

I've been coffee shop hopping a lot lately to find the perfect spot and I think I've found my new go-to place. This relatively new coffee shop is across from sunset park and fairly close to UNLV (but not close enough for it to be packed). So this is a great place to get some work done. 

The staff is always welcoming and friendly. And I just love the atmosphere and interior of this place. They have some food items and non-coffee drinks which I like as opposed to some shops that only serve coffee.

Such a cute coffeehouse. I like this place. Coffees are good, food are fresh and delicious. I ordered Sin city, it's huge and sweet. My friend tried Latte with macadamia syrup, it's so good. The service is nice and friendly.
Really great coffee shop and the owners are friendly! Ps i really loved the art displayed!!

My best friend and I have been on the search for new and interesting cafés in the valley for a few weeks now and this week we decided to try Pour. Many late night runs to the Robertos next store had us familiar with the shop but this was our first time trying out. It's was incredibly clean and bright; a nice change from lots of dusky/lowlight cafés I've been to. The menus was fairly extensive and had a good mix of coffees, blended drinks, teas, and sandwiches at really decent prices. The pistachio-soy blended I got was AMAZING! I also tried out their Apple cheddar with turkey, a first for me, and was pleasantly surprised by that as well. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, checking to make sure we liked everything and even let us try a really good espresso faux-martini. All and all I can't wait to come back and urge everyone to give Pour a try.
Really great coffee, friendly and knowledgeable staff with a wide selection of teas for your non-coffee drinking friends.

My friend and I were craving coffee and have been wanting to try this place for a while, so we decided to make a pit stop. 

This place has a beautiful set up - lots of natural light and windows. We were greeted right away by the baristas behind the counter. I decided on the iced latte (no syrups added). It was perfect! I usually like my coffee to be just a little sweet, so I added a stevia packet, but it tasted great without the added sweetness as well. 

My friend also got a latte and turned to me and said, "damn this is an amazing latte". She now says she lives dangerously close to this place and will make many more visits. 

We both fell in the love with the adorable potted succulents near the front door and each grabbed one to take home. I also came back a few days later to get one for my boss' birthday (and to grab another latte). Those make great gifts!

Very clean, and unique. There are African art displayed on the wall that makes it very different than other coffee shops. The Caribbean sandwich was amazing!! A mixture of sweet, salty and spicy, delicious!

Great coffee shop with delectable items and drinks to choose from. I like how the owner of the shop engages with her customers and involves herself with the community. From book clubs to political meets ups to discussing worldly issues. Great location right across from Sunset Park. Very relaxing space to be in while reading your books, working on emails or just something as simple as enjoyable cup of coffee.
Stopped by this morning to get coffee (Sin City Latte).  Very good latte. Good flavor.  Atmosphere is pleasant. Great view of Sunset Park.  Will come back.

Super good coffee. Cute modern inside. Nice sitting areas for hanging out with friends. Employees super nice. Construction terrible. Will make 5 stars when construction is done and maybe some outside sitting areas.

I love this place and I'm so happy it's close to my house.
They have an excellent selection of "blended" drinks, which are the sweet, tea-based drinks my girls and I always go for. 
They have an excellent selection of baked goods from the local "The Bake Shop." I have tried brownies, sugar cookies, gingerbread macarons (my fave!), muffins, and vegan chocolate chip cookies, and all have been very good.
The staff is beyond friendly. Every time we've been in, the owner has been in the shop and she remembers us and our order, and stops by to chat.
They're trying to really be part of the community in the hip coffee shop way. Starting by hosting open mic nights (mornings) for kids & teenagers in January! How cool is that? Even if my kids don't want to perform, we'll be in to see the other performers and support the cause, since proceeds are going to the Las Vegas Rescue Mission at those times.
Cherry on top: they have a substantial military discount.
Thanks, Pour, see you again soon!

Loved this place! It was my first time here and I absolutely fell in love. I have a thing for finding the best coffee shops in Las Vegas and this one has definitely made the list. If you have never been here before and are looking for something to eat I highly recommend The Caribbean Special. I also ordered the Green Me Up which is a blended green tea beverage. If you are a green tea lover like myself then you'll love the Green Me Up. The staff was very friendly and made me feel welcome. I came around one in the afternoon and it was not busy at all, I enjoy sitting down and eating my lunch in peace so if you are looking for a coffee shop that isn't so crowded I definitely suggest this place!

This is one of my favorite coffeeshops in town. Great service. Their coffee and specialty drinks are exceptional. Their tea menu is diverse. The shop has a comfortable atmosphere. They're progressive and culturally friendly, at any time of the day you could walk in and hear anything from salsa, jazz, and mariachi to classic rock and hip hop. They support local artists, musicians, and small businesses like Empress Edibles. On the third Saturday of every month they host a "brunch" with live music and a pop-up menu.

What a great little coffee shop, with a really nice laid back relaxing atmosphere, amazing customer service and wonderful coffee!

Stopped by yesterday to give it a try and am so glad I did. First thing I noticed as I walked in was how clean and bright the coffee shop was. I loved how the place was bright with natural lighting from all the large glass windows they have wrapped around the shop. All empty tables were clean, chairs were put in their proper place, tables had a nice plant on it which you can also buy, floors clean, trash was emptied, and the place were customers came put their empty cups was clean and organized as well. 

When I entered I was immediately greeted by one of the ladies working. She was very cheerful, had a smile on her face, and had a pleasant attitude about her. After I looked over their menu, I decided to try their hot mocha latte. By far, it was the best Mocha I've ever had. It was super smooth without leaving a gritty residue on the bottom of the cup which I've come to expect from Starbucks mocha. 

As I enjoyed my coffee, I also enjoyed the quiet atmosphere. The music they had playing was soft but loud enough that you could tell what was playing. The other customers in the shop were considerate of others and made sure to keep their conversations low as to not disturb others that were studying. 

The shop was nicely decorated with paintings, plants, and other coffee-related decoration without looking cluttered. 

Would recommend this spot to anyone who loves coffee.
Great coffee. Cute place and like the artwork.  Easy to get to and good parking available.
I was in town for a month and would come here at least 5 times a week to work. This place really makes you feel at home. Great vibes and great people.

This place has amazing food and the best coffee in town. Those "other coffee places" ain't got nothin on Pour Coffeehouse!!! 

Want a special treat??? Try the iced white chocolate coffee, but get a large or you'll be left wanting more when you're medium runs out:( And their sandwiches...YUM!!! That's just the start. 

This place is always clean and the service is top notch. This is an amazing place to grab a bite to eat and a coffee to get you thru your day and once you've come here, you'll come back over and over:)
Great fun spot to get an amazing latte and have a great meeting! Locally owned and operated. Don't want coffee? They have food and smoothies too!!!

I walked into Pour Coffeehouse just after 11:00am this morning and was greeted right away by Deborah. First off, when you are greeted with a hello and a smile you know you will have a good experience.
Well, my experience was great!

I ordered an iced latte and the Breakfast Bombness which translates to heaven on a wheat English muffin. The muffin was hot and filled with the lightest scrambled eggs, bacon, avocado, tomato, cream cheese and spinach. It was healthy and delicious so whats not to like? My latte was one of the best I have had in a very long time.

Did I mention that the coffee aroma grabs you the minute you walk in the door? Or that this place is so clean that you could literally eat off of the floor?

When you are on the east side of Vegas stop in and grab a bite to eat, you will not be sorry.

Ambience is nice. We came in Sunday morning and it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the lavender latte and it was really good. My bf got the Red Bull, it's pretty good! Reminds us of Dutch bros strawberry rebel. We also ordered avocado toast. It was alright thought it would come with a bigger toast but it was 3 small toasts. Overall, I'd come back and try the other lattes. Not so much for the foods.

First time here, super cute shop! Very friendly service and quick too. Super bright shop, a real eye opener! The owners clearly love mid century modern and have decorated the shop tastefully.  
Sandwiches are yummy and coffee was excellent!

Not sure I would run back to this location.  Ordered the Turkey sandwich.  They didn't ask me if I wanted it on a croissant or wrap so they just made it on the croissant (and I actually wanted the wrap).  The prices were ok... $7 for the sandwich and some chips, however, there is barely any turkey on the sandwich.  It took awhile for it to be made as well.  I would try other options in the area before returning.

This place has been on my mind since I first saw them open. I never got the chance to come for a visit, but today, I came to finally check it out. 

It's a great place to study since it's quiet, bright, and spacious. I'm a huge fan of the bright, natural light they get in the store itself. It looks like they have a bookcase with records and a record player near the cashier, so I'm assuming you can choose one and ask them to play it. Really neat idea on their part!

The menu has your classic lattes, coffees, cold brews, pour overs, etc, but there's also some more original creations like the red bull express. I got the london fog with almond milk, and I like how it's not overly sweet. It's just a hint of sweetness, and the tea flavor is very evident. The drink itself has that fragrant bergamot. I can only vouch for the london fog as of right now, but Pour is charming and will have you coming back.

They do have a "Study Sesh" on Wednesday where drinks are 2 for 1, so you can hang out, study, and get a great deal on coffee. Combined with a 15% off for university students, what's not to love?

Overall, Pour is a solid study and coffee shop. It's quiet, spacious, and bright-- aka perfect for studying. The pricing is pretty decent and with 15% off for students, it's a great deal. I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

I just had a Bombness breakfast sandwich at the Pour and it was the BOMB. The service was wonderful and they made me feel at home. It was pleasant going to a local place instead of this big guys. The loose leaf green tea was a great way to start my day.

Ok so I was looking for SB  and I used yelp and it gave me POUR  as a option.  I  was pretty desperate but omg what a blessing.  Staff excellent,  cleanliness impeccable, felt very comfortable with the handling of my food and drink.
Free wifi, great conversation with employees just felt good and will be returning when I am back in town. 
Go RAMS LOL

Definitely a five star spot for the area. This spot has been on my radar for awhile and I finally made it in for lunch last week. 

Pour is located on Eastern between Warm Springs and Sunset. They are in the same lot as Heidi's and the Subway. The location is easy to access and there was plenty of parking even at noon on a weekday.

The menu offers sandwiches, coffees, unique blended beverages, sweets, teas, and waffles (on weekends). I was impressed with the selection for a coffee shop.

As soon as I walked in I was warmly greeted. I placed my order and took a seat while I waited for my lunch to be prepared. My order took a moment, but was worth the wait. While I waited I noted that this was one of the cleanest shops I've visited. That is always a good thing when ordering food.

The Pistachio Delight drink was the main thing that lured me to this spot and didn't disappoint. Yum! It definitely had the rich pistachio flavor I was seeking. My lunch choice, It's All About Me was very tasty. The simple flavors came together well. I loved the toasted bread and the melted cheese with the basil flavor. I opted for the salad instead of chips. This was a nice serving of spinach with some fresh raspberries and a light vinaigrette on top. For dessert I chose the Salted Caramel Apple Pie. A third yum for this sweet. It definitely had a homemade taste and hit the spot.

As I was finishing my lunch I was asked if everything was good and if I needed anything else. I thought it was nice that they continue to check on customers. At this point I asked if my Pistachio Delight could be transferred to a to go container and they gladly handled that request. 

Great spot! I'll definitely be back for lunch and drinks in the future.

This is my first time here and The manager and employees are amazing!  I came by yesterday but they were having electrical problems so I couldn't purchase anything but the manager kindly gave me a free drink for today for the trouble 

The atmosphere is really sweet and it's absolutely adorable inside. 
Everyone is so friendly, the manager was talking to us about new ideas for drinks for the fall and I actually nerded out with one of the Batistas about longboards, we even have matching scars on our elbow  

I'm definitely coming back. I kinda forgot to get my card stamped so hopefully I can still do that next time I come in. 

This place is sweet and definitely a need to stop by kind of place. Definitely lots of options as well; from coffee, tea, snowball drinks, to sandwiches and baked goods 

I can't wait to come again

Looking for breakfast that wasn't fast food or too heavy and this place was perfect. Not much breakfast items but I highly recommend the breakfast bomb. I wish this place was closer to my house but definitely a new morning spot for after the gym!
This is the cutest coffee house! I got just a simple vanilla latte with almond milk and it was delicious. Extremely cute decor and located right across from sunset park. Love it here!

I visited Pour the first week that they opened around 11:00 AM. I was the only customer in the establishment and three of the employees were sitting down and looked like they were eating. The barista who took my order was very nice but seemed a little confused and didn't know much about their menu options. When asked if they had sugar free syrups he at first didn't know and then confirmed that they did not (bummer) but offered Agave instead. I then ordered a black coffee and latte and it took quite a while to receive my order considering I was the only person in there. I found that there prices were quite high as well (compared to nearby competition). It seemed like the staff was unfamiliar with working the computer but I tried to let that go considering it was the first week of their grand opening. The establishment itself had a lot of seating area to work or meet with friends. I was impressed with the cleanliness and decor but unfortunately was not sold on the overall experience.

Went to pour today for the first time. It's was a lovely experience, I ordered a chi tea latte and my husband got a mocha latte and I ordered my son a smore cookie. The owner Debora introduced herself and was very nice. I would seriously recommend this little coffee shop. Both our drinks were delicious

Love this place! Beautifully designed, bright and inviting. The breakfast bombness and avocado toast are delicious! The Melonade was very refreshing (my 5 year old enjoyed it) and my hazelnut lattes are always perfect. It has quickly become our local favorite!

I went to Pour with my good friend for our weekly coffee date. Neither us had been, and we were pleasantly surprised by how awesome it was. The staff was helpful and kind, and the drinks were delicious! They had a postcard on the counter with a picture of a delicious looking drink on it. So I pointed to it and asked the barista if I could order it. She made it exactly like the postcard, an iced caramel macchiato, and it was so tasty! We'll definitely be back.
This coffeehouse can do no wrong! Seriously, the customer service is amazing. If you're a coffee aficionado, ask them to recommend something. Their recommendations have always been delicious!!

This place has a slow chill vibe. Barista was super friendly. Setup inside was nice, nice choice of furniture. Their espresso was strong as it should be, but with a smooth taste, low acidity. May be back if i am in the area, unfortunately the location is kinda out of the way.
Best local coffee shop in the area! Checkout Debra and her staff of baristas they make really good coffees and espressos. They also serve breakfast and lunch sandwiches.

I got a coffee here and asked for cream. Their cream was the Walmart house brand cream. No joke. I'd never buy that for myself and clearly they don't care about the source of their ingredients or quality. Good coffee, nice concept, but deceiving in some ways.

Stopped in to do some work on my computer, and have a bite to eat. The atmosphere was especially splendid. Bright and welcoming, with a calm and cool vibe. I had a Breakfast Bombness sandwich that was so good, I inhaled it. The cold brew is strong and kept me focused. The super positive part I liked was that the owner came and introduced herself and welcomed me. That speaks volumes on how a business should run. I wholeheartedly recommend this place as a quiet oasis with strong coffee, and delicious food!

Bruh, I like this place. Conveniently placed next to the park for a nice stroll with coffee in hand. I hate how I love the art work posted up cuz I wanna buy now. Quite trendy, I felt like I needed to wear suspenders. Will be back because... They good

So glad I decided to get out of my coffee comfort zone and try new places. I came here by recommendation and I am so glad I gave it a try. This coffee shop is really laid back with tons of paintings, plants, natural light from all the windows, and lots of seating areas. 

I ended up getting the large iced cold brew and since I was staying there while I drank my coffee, the put it in a cute mason jar. Something nice I like about non-chain coffee places. They actually make drinks and food and put them on actual plates and glass cups when you're staying in. 

The cold brew was amazing, better tasting than it is at Starbucks. On top of the great tasting coffee, the employee was such a pleasant person. She was patient, knowledgeable, and very friendly. 

Come here if you want great coffee, amazing service and a wonderful atmosphere..you won't be disappointed.

I was in a conference for 2 Days in Las Vegas and the casino I was staying at was slowly ripping the soul from my body. Luckily I escaped to Pour. The worker and owner were super nice. It was a great spot to do some work for 4 hours before my flight. Free WiFi. Great work space. Great coffee - great sandwich. Got a ton of work done. Thank you!!!!
The friendliest staff and the tastiest coffee this side of the Brooklyn bridge.  Best in town 2016!

This is small, family-owned coffee house is a gem in the middle of all that Eastern Ave. construction. 

I went there for a poetry reading, for which they kept it open a little later than normal. The staff was friendly and kind, and the iced mocha latte I got was out of this world. 

I did not get to try any of the food, but the menu looked so great that I took a picture of it and sent it to my husband.  We will definitely come back. Great little place!

Pour is a new coffeeshop and became my go to this week while visiting in Las Vegas. Tastebuds have been happy. I love the location across from Sunset Park, the space is very bright and open. The staff are friendly and the owner has a great rapport with her team. Good music and vibe overall. 

Now the tasty stuff. Their cold brew is excellent, Deborah the owner explained how they prepare the brew to get the great rich flavor. I am also a fan of their Crimson Berry Fruit iced tea w a splash of sparkling water. I'd come down here in the dead heat of summer for that delicious iced tea. 

I tried their rich chocolate brownie, decadent. The pumpkin muffin light, moist and fluffy, and I'm a big fan of their macaroons. I wasn't even big on macaroons before. They're light, tasty, rich and creamy. 

I've also tried their Apple Cheddar and Breakfast Bombness. The Apple Cheddar is yummy. Toasted bread, apple slices, fig jam, melted cheese? Um. Hello, delicious. Finally, the Breakfast Bombness is a flavor trip, avocado, tomato, bacon, cream cheese, spinach - the flavors melted together and the bacon gives it a savory kick, all in an English muffin. Loved it. 

The construction is a bit of a pain (for everyone customers and business owners in the area, there's so much all over LV), but I got my rhythm. Going South on S Eastern, cross Sunset, Pama Lane and right after that is the entrance to Pour. 

I used to live in Las Vegas, for two years. At the time I'd go to Sunrise. When I came across Pour this week I was struck by the brightness of the place and the big windows overlooking the park. For a very new business, I'm impressed with the quality of food they put out and the flavors owner Deborah has come up with.

Came under the recommendation of a friend and from seeing a post on a friend's IG. Definitely going to come back and try the rest of their selection.

Since I've been coffee'd out, I went and did the Barbados Yellow Bird and the Breakfast Bombness. Both great. Didn't expect to like the cream cheese on the breakfast sandwich, but it made it so creamy. Loved the grapes served as an accompaniment to the sandwich.

For dessert, I went and tried the mini salted caramel apple pie and Chai tea latte. It was a perfect ending and start for the day to go to the DMV. The apple pie was perfect in size. The treat was washed down with an almond milk Chai tea latte sweetened with honey. With Deborah's recommendation I will definitely be back to try the Chai tea with vanilla which she describes as "enhances the flavor of the chai." I'm sold. Need to do it soon too as I was informed she is switching vendors to a Portland tea company (I'm horrible with names and my memory is gone haha).

Will definitely be coming back.

Pour is awesome!! I find that most coffee shops make their coffee/espresso drinks too sweet or sugary which I am not a fan of at all. I usually tend to avoid flavored espresso drinks because they're too sweet but I'm in love with their hazelnut iced lattes and I also would recommend their cappuccinos.

The staff is always so sweet and friendly! I also like studying at Pour more than other coffee shops in the area. They play good music but nothing too loud/obnoxious like at other coffee shops so you can still focus on your work.

It's a five minute walk from my house so I decided to check it out. The place is very clean, nice and quaint. The staff is friendly. As far as what I had which was the Chai Tea Latte it wasnt bad. I can't say it blew me away but it was good. I'd definitely say stop by and check it out!

It's amazing what places you'll discover while going through life inconveniences. 
I hate driving through construction, fortunately it lead me to this great little coffeehouse. 
Pour serves up scrumptious sandwiches, desserts, and coffee so well brewed I'll be coming back for more.

A unique selection of specialty lattes, iced and blended drinks. The one that stood out for me was the Macadamia Nut Latte. It wasn't too sweet and it had a roasted nutty flavor.

They only serve paninis / grill sandwiches from 8am to 2pm, so if you can make the time try some of these. Fear not if you can't, they still offer sandwiches after 2pm that doesn't require grilling. On weekends only, the 4 waffle sampler is a must try. I tried to convince them to serve it all week but I guess it would lose it's appeal, so that didn't work.  

The most popular is Breakfast Bombness which consists of tomato, avocado, spinach, bacon, cream cheese on warm, toasted buttered English muffin. This is a delicious sandwich to eat any part of the day, especially breakfast.  Don't be scared to try the Apple Cheddar Turkey Panini, the flavors goes along the similar path as the Bobbi from Caps.

Pour also has an assortment of desserts that they receive from The Baking Cup, a wholesome bakery all the way in Summerlin. I've heard of them through various other bakeries around town so I know they have a solid reputation. Since it's not always convenient for me to drive all the there, I'll stick to going to Pour to satisfy my sweet tooth. The brownies and cookies are my weakness.

Deborah and her staff are kind and warm hearted people. Every time I go I'm always greeted with a smile, it's just a pleasant coffee shop to be around.

Came in a little before 8 and the barista noticed me and opened early! It was my first time there so I started using Starbucks language and was scolded... Not that it's a bad thing . I'll be back to try one of the sandwiches, some interesting creations.

Excellent.  I had the cafe con leche and the turkey sandwich, clean, friendly service, and good food and coffee. I can't review the wifi because I didn't bring my laptop, but I will return and I plan on being a frequent visitor
Cool ambiance, great customer service and high quality coffee are always great things. Pour has all of the above! Will be back to try the food!

Cute little cozy coffee shop. They have a variety of different drinks and things to eat. Never too crazy busy and the people who work there are always friendly and attentive. I love the atmosphere too!

Sitting in Pour enjoying my almond milk Hazelnut Latte, while my son has a mint chamomile tea with a salted caramel apple pie. I love the modern atmosphere, excellent service, beautifully simple ceramics, and super clean restroom (!).

My latte is AH-mazing, my son is VERY happy! Emily, the barista...fabulous and friendly! Deborah, the owner...equally fabulous and friendly!

I wouldn't hesitate to come back for a breakfast/coffee date, or later in the day to sample their lunch menu.

Thanks, ladies!
Awesome place, love how clean and classy the place is. Delicious coffee and awesome park view.
Great atmosphere with a friendly staff!  The cappuccino was tasty (and I'm very particular).  Come here and enjoy your morning.
Stopped in for a quick lunch and had the apple cheddar pannini with a french press coffee both of which were served promptly and were delicious.

Let me start by saying that it's really hard to be able to find a good coffee place around here. I know, I know, there are tons but after trying a good 2-3 of them, I get tired of looking for more. I'm not a huge coffee drinker so I'm not that persistent in trying to find the place. However, I think I've found a place that I could go to if I ever need coffee. Pour. 

Saw this on yelp, got decent reviews, and decided why the heck not? I had a little bit of time to kill before work so lets give this a try and I'm so glad I did. 

The barista that was there the morning I went was very very helpful. I forgot her name but she's the one that's allergic to bread! I told her what I liked and what I didn't like. I do not like acidic coffee. I prefer something smooth and fragrant. I do not like diabetes in a cup so I prefer something that's not too sweet. 

I ended up choosing the macadamia nut latte and I have to say that it's really smooth. It isn't acidic at all which is PERFECT! They don't use an acidic coffee base! Yayy!! It was just really delicious!  It was a bit on the sweeter side but it's nothing that I can't handle. It didn't punch me in the face. I think that when I go next time, I'll probably get just an iced coffee or get another macadamia nut latte but lessen the sweetness. 

Definitely coming back and definitely recommend people to give them a try.

Because I am a small business owner, it is the VERY REASON I came to this particular establishment!  I love, love, loooooove new coffee AND tea shops! In fact, I prefer them over chains and am happy to be a frequent and generous patron. 

What I do not expect is to be blatantly disregarded and spoken to poorly by the owner, "Deborah A"!  

There are so many coffee aficionados out there, why does it seem so odd that there are tea aficionados as well?   Considering I Yelp'd for "tea" (not "coffee & tea") and this establishment popped up, I had the expectation of a selection of teas.  When offered only six varieties, none of them a basic black tea, from my point of view this establishment's TEA (not coffee) selection ~was~ "minuscule and sad."    

I'm seriously not sure how arguing with a customer is beneficial.  All it would take is a bit more customer service, and a bit more research in improving one's tea selection.

One of the finest coffee shops I've found, and quite randomly too. 

Nice choice of music too, and on vinyl!

Amazing , coffee, food and service. I picked this place for my sisters bridal shower and the manger was so nice and sweet. She was very responsive in emailing me what she could help me with, overall great place

When I first walked in I thought it was a little warm but eventually the AC kicked in and now it feels comfortable. Overall this place is pretty Delicious! You definitely have to try the 3 bean bowl here.
Americana coffee great! The London fog iced tea is good for a hot day.

3 stars for me means I liked it. There is room for improvement. 

TL:DR version:

The coffee tastes good...but they messed up our coffee orders and one of the food orders.

Overall it was a good experience if you can forgive their mistakes because they are new.

Considering what you get at elsewhere in the area(Sunrise, mothership, and grouchy Johns are my norm)... They cost the same but you get less food for it. Coffee prices are normal. 

--------------------------------

Detailed version:

We ordered 2 coffees and 2 sandwiches.

Mistake #1) Ordered "large decaf coffee with a little room for cream."
What I got was a coffee with creamer added for me. They put in way more creamer than I normally take. 

Fix: Let customers add their own cream. I would have felt like a schmuck for asking them to dump their coffee so I could fix it the way I like, so didn't.

Mistake #2) Hubbie ordered a large house drip decaf. What he got was a coffee with cream. He drinks it black. 

Fix: Don't add cream for customers. Here are 2 mistakes on our first time visit. Because of their awesome competition in the area we kind of expect coffee houses to get coffee down right off the bat. Again ...hate waste so he drank it.

Mistake #3 we ordered 2 sandwiches. Hubbie did not want his chips. I ordered breakfast bombness with a fruit cup. I think it's called that. It's the first sandwich on the panini menu. What I got was a sandwich without a fruit cup...because they never entered it into the order.  If it's supposed to have chips as a default, then I did not get chips. I also expected a sandwich packed full of tomato slices, avocado, spinach... Etc etc. Very skimpy on filling. Very flat sandwich. Small. Tasty but small. I could taste the avocado and bacon but if the other ingredients were there, it just got lost. It's just a simple proportion problem. But if this is how the sandwich is supposed to be, then I'm just not a fan of their sandwich style.

Fix:   this is probably an issue of new staff unfamiliar or not completely comfortable with the payment system yet and punching up the order. The impression I got was they were half listening and half focused on entering the order. This issue will likely go away as staff is more familiar and experienced.

What it boils down to is, their competition is still better. It's not enough for ME to include them into our list of regular hang outs yet. But maybe once they are settled in a bit more. 

We're willing to give a second chance.

I really can't say enough great things about this place. Just go in and feel the vibe... Fantastic fresh food in a thoughtful and beautifully designed environment! Go in and try everything on the menu at least once! Better food here than half the places on the strip.

Pour has a great atmosphere, albeit a bit tight when they get busy. The staff is super accommodating and the service overall is excellent. They host small groups for community events and meetings so it's a great place to network within the community as well. The chai tea latte in my opinion is one of the best in the area by far! They make an exceptional latte and the Togo cups are awesome to run out on the road with. Certainly a must try

Hands down THEE best iced chai tea latte in town. The employees are always friendly and know my order before I even make it through the door. If you're in the area, do yourself a favor and treat yo'self!

Came to check out the new coffee house, right off the bat it's nice to see a coffee shop open up near the business park, as well as sunset park. 

Loved the coffee drinks. Got a regular latte and also a white chocolate latte. Both drinks were very good in my opinion, but of course I'm no coffee bean expert. All I can say is though I very much prefer it over most other places including the large corporate chains. Pastries are offered here also, and had items that catered to those who are in a vegan diet. 

It's still a new place, so I'm sure they will be further enhancing the decor inside. Looked a little plain, but did have quite a number of seats. Hopefully things pick up here and they can make the insides a little cozier.
Deb is the bomb! The ambiance is nice. The pistachio is my fave! Check this place out!
Coffee is excellent! It doesn't taste burnt like some of your competition. Atmosphere is fantastic! Employees are extremely friendly and helpful.
Great local coffee house. Coffee, tea, & food were all good. Service was friendly. Breakfast sandwich and macaron were so good my mom stole bites of mine & then wanted her own.
Can't beat the coffee and food here. Had the All About Me sandwich with pesto and it was the excellent. Girlfriend had the Vegan Black Bean and Avocado wraps which were so good, a must try!!
Delicious pistacho delight my fave since i started going there i recommend you guys try i if you havent already...
